results.title: Australian identity. Yrs 7-10
results.brief_description: A program presented in ten segments on the Australian identity. 1. What’s an identity? 2. What’s an Australian? 3. Popular legends. 4. Aboriginal identity. 5. People left out of our legends. 6. Defiance of authority. 7. The Anzac legend. 8. White colonial Australia. 9. Legends about women. 10. Changing national identity. Uses extracts from early Australian feature films and stills to focus on the question of who are Australians.

results.title: Australian Heritage: holly green country
results.creator_credit: National Trust, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
Shows the oldest existing homestead in Victoria, Holly Green farm 1836. Also Rupertswood 1870, and Glen Eira homestead 1857. Written by Eileen Berry.

results.title: Australian heritage [compilation]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
Old Parramatta - after Sydney, the oldest city in Australia. Historic Hawksbury - the valley was settled shortly after the arrival of the First Fleet in 1788. Elizabeth Bay House - an outstanding example of colonial architecture. Goolwa - a town near the mouth of the Murray in South Australia. Kurralta - a famous historic house near Adelaide. Marion - a River Murray paddle steamer.

results.title: Australian heritage [compilation]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
Ornamental iron - fine examples of the iron work. Bathurst - 100 miles west of Sydney is a town with many fine Victorian Renaissance buildings. Iron lace - imported and locally made, was more extensively used in Australia than anywhere else in the world. Aboriginal rock art - is preserved by the National Parks and Wild Life Service of N.S.W.

results.title: Australian gold rushes. - Years 7-10.
results.brief_description: Provides a general overview of the Australian gold rush period 1850-1900. It is presented in three segments: 1. “Discoveries”. - 2. “Gold rushes 1800-1900”. - 3. “Mining methods”. Consists of re-enactments, segments from early Australian feature films and stills from the period. This video would also be suitable for younger students.

Consists of re-enactments, segments from early Australian feature films and stills from the period.

results.title: Australian gazette. No. 363
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Adelaide dog show; Bronzetti wins the Caulfield Cup against Chrome and Rael Loein; Rocket wins the Sydney Flying Squadron’s handicap in the opening event of the sailing season on Sydney Harbour and 85 unions are represented at the annual eight hour day demonstrations.
results.description: Magazine items: Adelaide dog show; Bronzetti wins the Caulfield Cup against Chrome and Rael Loein; Rocket wins the Sydney Flying Squadron’s handicap in the opening event of the sailing season on Sydney Harbour and 85 unions are represented at the annual eight hour day demonstrations.
